item.title: Days and Ghost Refinements
item.description: Let’s look at the simple function, which calculates the number of days between dates, when there’re 30 days in a month (and 360 in a year). Something like this F# code: 1 2 let days360 sy sm sd ey em ed = (ey - sy) * 360 + (em - sm) * 30 + (ed - sd) We can even write a bunch of tests to be sure the function works:
